As an AI language model, sure, I can suggest a few things you might try to improve your decision-making skills in Hearthstone:

1. Practice regularly: Practice is the best way to improve your decision-making skills in Hearthstone. The more you play, the more you'll learn about each card's strengths and weaknesses and how to use them effectively. 2. Analyze game scenarios: Analyzing various game scenarios can help you build a stronger game sense and increase your decision-making ability. Take the time to analyze what move would be the best. Also, try to watch and learn from other players' gameplay through streams or videos. 3. Think ahead: Thinking ahead and planning your next few moves is key to success in Hearthstone. Always think about your upcoming turns, and what your opponent is likely to do, to prepare yourself for different possibilities. 4. Learn from mistakes: Learn from your mistakes by analyzing your games after you've played them or even asking the opponent why he played a specific card or how they came to make that decision will provide some clarity. 5. Use external resources: There are multiple online resources like deck builders or guides, tutorials, blogs, and forums, etc. that can help you improve your decision-making ability, so don't be afraid to seek help or advice from others to improve your variant gameplay. Remember, improving your decision-making ability takes practice, experience, and learning from your mistakes. Eventually, you will be able to make sound decisions during gameplay, leading to more wins.
